item.title: Ticket #450 (GMT offset is too static) created
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description:
Recently, a great part of the world had a switch to daylight savings. It seems like WP isn't quite capable of that.

First, i had to manually change GMT offset to update it to the current one, and second (even more weird) -- the dates (at least, the displayed dates of today's comments) haven't changed accordingly. I consider it as a bug.

item.title: Ticket #449 (Any file containing "install" in it name seems to have trouble running ...) created
item.dc:creator: drdave
item.description: "install" only needs to be a substring (e.g. "install_myplugin.php") for the session authentication to fail (get_current_userinfo() doesn't set any variable)... removing it from the filename fixes the problem. Easy fix, ages to figure such a behaviour...

item.title: Ticket #448 (Special Characters in Category Names) created
item.dc:creator: code freak
item.description:
If you try to put a special character, using the HTML entity, in a category name, it displays the HTML entity code instead of the special character.

If I copy the symbol from somewhere else, such as Microsoft Word, and paste it in the category name, the character shows up correctly.

As a side note, in WP 1.2.1, HTML entities could be used to enter special characters in category names.

item.title: Ticket #438 (Pound sign (#) in spam words causes comment errors) closed
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
20:

Commited a fix for this on 2004/11/05. Does not strip #, but escapes them, so that they are allowed in spamword patterns.

item.title: Ticket #438 (Pound sign (#) in spam words causes comment errors) updated
item.dc:creator: dougal

item.title: Ticket #447 (Admin login flashes error message but logs in anyways) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Everytime I login through the admin panel, for a split second after I hit login, I get a red error message stating that the password field is empty. But, it's not and it does allow me to login. When I don't enter a password at wall on purpose but enter my userid, I get the error message stating that incorrect password entered. But, I didn't enter a password at all. This problem is minor because I am still able to login properly. Also, if any other user logins to my site, it does the same thing to them. My site is located at ​http://www.marginalspace.com

item.title: Changeset [1850]: Issue a 404 if a permalink request does not match any posts.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Issue a 404 if a permalink request does not match any posts.

item.title: Ticket #446 (add_magic_quotes is redefined in admin.php and blocks any plugin that ...) created
item.dc:creator: drdave
item.description: latest CVS defines 'add_magic_quotes' in the admin.php file... since it reuses the name commonly used by hundreds of php devs around, this is likely to make certain plugin crash. since it can be included after the plugin has defined its own 'add_magic_quotes', adding 'function_exists()' in the plugin is inefficient...

item.title: Changeset [1849]: Avoid polluting the category cache with duplicate category lists when ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Avoid polluting the category cache with duplicate category lists when using multiple post loops. ​http://wordpress.org/support/6/15213. Fix from Owen Winkler.
